<a id="EditorScript"></a>

# EditorScript

**Inherits:** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

Base script that can be used to add extension functions to the editor.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Scripts extending this class and implementing its [_run()](EditorScript.md#EditorScript_private_method__run) method can be executed from the Script Editor's **File &gt; Run** menu option (or by pressing :kbd:`Ctrl + Shift + X`) while the editor is running. This is useful for adding custom in-editor functionality to Redot. For more complex additions, consider using [EditorPlugin](EditorPlugin.md)\\ s instead.

If a script extending this class also has a global class name, it will be included in the editor's command palette.

\ **Note:** Extending scripts need to have ``tool`` mode enabled.

\ **Example:** Running the following script prints "Hello from the Redot Editor!":




```gdscript
    @tool
    extends EditorScript

    func _run():
        print("Hello from the Redot Editor!")
```


```csharp
    using Godot;

    [Tool]
    public partial class HelloEditor : EditorScript
    {
        public override void _Run()
        {
            GD.Print("Hello from the Redot Editor!");
        }
    }
```




\ **Note:** EditorScript is [RefCounted](RefCounted.md), meaning it is destroyed when nothing references it. This can cause errors during asynchronous operations if there are no references to the script.

## Method Descriptions

<a id="EditorScript_private_method__run"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **_run**\ (\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> <span class="required">required</span> [ðŸ”—](#EditorScript_private_method__run)

This method is executed by the Editor when **File &gt; Run** is used.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorScript_method_add_root_node"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **add_root_node**\ (\ node\: [Node](Node.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#EditorScript_method_add_root_node)

Makes `node` root of the currently opened scene. Only works if the scene is empty. If the `node` is a scene instance, an inheriting scene will be created.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="EditorScript_method_get_editor_interface"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[EditorInterface](EditorInterface.md) **get_editor_interface**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#EditorScript_method_get_editor_interface)

**Deprecated:** [EditorInterface](EditorInterface.md) is a global singleton and can be accessed directly by its name.

Returns the [EditorInterface](EditorInterface.md) singleton instance.

<a id="EditorScript_method_get_scene"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Node](Node.md) **get_scene**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#EditorScript_method_get_scene)

Returns the edited (current) scene's root [Node](Node.md). Equivalent of [EditorInterface.get_edited_scene_root()](EditorInterface.md#EditorInterface_method_get_edited_scene_root).
